It happens. The best of the best make mistakes every now and then. We just need to get over it and move on. And we should stop calling him trash just because he made mistakes (which he made up for later in the game by making 6 saves). People are talking about how we need to replace him. Everyone just chill out, he's fine. He even made two saves later on that could have been save of the week worthy (the one where he came off his line to win a 1 v 1 and a last second palm on a ball heading to the roof of the goal). Also if we are going to start calling people bad tonight we mustn't forget that Gil missed a easy goal scoring opportunity and the defense left Joe out to dry on the last 2 goals. This could have been a 2-1 game instead of a 4-0 game. But Jesus I've never seen people turn so quickly on someone that has been integral for a team simply because of a couple mistakes(This isn't necessarily directed at you, just something I've noticed tonight from the fanbase and mls as a whole).
He doesnt get a pass but he wasnt terrible. At least not for the entire game.

Mediocre saves? one of them was the defense leaving him completely out to dry with him having to make a 1 v 1 save and another was him making a great save on a ball on near post. Also goalkeeping isn't just about making the saves. He came off his line perfectly every time and created some good plays with his distribution. I think you have an unrealistic standard for a goalkeeper. Keepers make mistakes too. Not saying they should go unnoticed but besides the first near post mistake and the 2nd goal that went in he was great.
I think you turned off the game too early. He was bad at first but after goal 2 he's been great.
He wiffed one. The other he blocked but it bounced under him.
Im going back to feeling bad for Bendik. He's stepping up and making the saves now after a rocky start but the defense is screwing him.
Joe bendik made some mistakes but he is the only reason why this game isnt 7-0. Defense is non-existent.
And this is last year Orlando defense.
I have to agree. The first goal was a mistake but that one was a super low and fast shot. That one was a pretty hard one to stop.

why? because he's human and makes mistakes? I mean he should've saved that no doubt but his defense isnt doing him any favors this game either. This is his first real decent mistake I can think of in recent memory that he has made. If we are judging National Team callups on if the person makes a mistake every once in a while then Rimando, Bingham and probably Howard are all out too.

The issue with Hamid is that he is insanely injury prone for whatever reason. I think that alone ruins his chances. Also I think they just need to find a number 1 keeper in his mid-late 20's so they can have someone to hold down the fort for a few years while they look for the new young talent they need. I just think constantly calling up mid thirty year old keepers that are proven is stupid. Call up one old keeper that is proven and then two younger new guys. That way you have someone thats really good and then backups. Maybe even one of the new guys will end up being really good. Its hard to tell whose actually good based on club performance alone sometimes.

I have to agree, they live in a very nice house in a good part of LA so obviously they arent exactly short on money. I think they should put their efforts to finding a alternative income/platform to post on rather than make videos every couple of weeks complaining about YouTube. It's their site and they can do whatever they want on it. That's what you signed up for when you became a content creator on YouTube. But Ethan and Hila can afford to keep the channel going a for a while without having a crazy good income so I think they should adjust to posting somewhere that's smaller that pays content creators better(if such a thing exists) or just move to Twitch. I don't get the whole "I'm just gonna complain and hope something changes" attitude that every single big YouTuber seems to have. If every single big YouTuber that has complained about the YouTube rules all collectively decided to up and leave the site then YouTube would take a massive hit and would have to make changes to get them back but instead they all just do nothing. I just don't get it.

I agree. Being a top quality goalkeeper is about being good, and being consistently good. If you have more than 3 or 4 bad games in a row right when you're supposed to be in your prime like he is than you are running the high risk of losing your national team spot as there are at least 4 other goalkeepers at around his age dying for a spot and showing that they have the ability to play for the USMNT. I'm sorry but I think Bingham has just played himself out of his spot.
Yea this article makes it sound like we dont have 4-5 other goalkeepers that havnt even been called up before that are doing good in their respective leagues rn.
Bingham has always been ahead of him. But now bingham is falling quick and bendik has continued to rise.

Okay but maybe wait to make those criticisms on saves that he doesn't make? I feel like criticizing someone on how they made a save is a bit dumb. There are so many things happening in those couple of seconds so its no wonder his feet work may look shotty in a slowed down version of the save. What you're doing is like criticizing the way someone scored a goal. You can find flaws in anyone's play if you look hard enough.
Here that one is: https://twitter.com/TotalMLS/status/856227715308978178

For real. I feel like breaking down a save based on foot positioning and nitpicking what's wrong is a bit much. He saved the ball, that's all that matters. I didn't see this much criticism for frei's save at the MLS Cup or Melia"s last week.

I feel like every time anything good is posted about Bendik there is always a hate train that follows. It seems like he's the only keeper that gets criticized a crazy amount even after performing amazing countless times. Meanwhile Bingham is consistently having awful games left and right and hes still ahead of Bendik to a lot of people. I'm not saying Bendik is a perfect goalie but he cant seem to have any exposure on r/MLS without getting insane levels of criticism. Like way more than every other goalie that gets the spotlight here.

People say that every year and continues to get better and better. This is the first year he's had a competent defense and he still looks really good. I dont understand where all the doubt comes from. Bingham is having some of the worst games of his career and people still say he is way ahead of bendik. I just dont get it.

Thanks man! This is pretty much exactly what I was looking for. More people that felt a similar way. Not just instant downvoting because I had a different opinion. I feel like a lot of the times its hard to blast some newer 311 tracks in my car with the windows down because it just gets so cheesy when SA starts rapping. "Too late" is the best example, it's very heavy and awesome to blast on my sound system with my windows down but then when it gets to SA's rap parts that are kinda slow, it makes me feel really cheesy for some reason. A lot of his stuff I am very okay with though and I even actually love some of his songs. But for me a lot of recent stuff from him has been a major miss.
I liked a lot of stuff that he did on "Stereolithic" with that song being one of them. "Revelation of the year" is a different story though.

Exactly. "Running" is actually also one of my favorite songs. I love his older stuff because it was just different and felt like it belonged but now when he randomly chimes in and does a slow rap it turns me off to the song. It's just too cheesy for me.
Roses are red, violets are blue. Gimme a nintendo switch so I can play zelda in a zoo.
I said one of my favorite songs is one of his. How is that negative? I'm saying I dont know how I feel about it anymore because it seems out of style.
I never once said he sucked. I said his rapping on the newest stuff sounds sounds outdated/cheesy.

Thats more or less what I was hitting at too. I feel like its either an element that adds a lot to a song or takes away a lot from the song. I loved "too late" until his rapping part. It felt like a real heavy song and then suddenly theres like the SA rapping part which make it seem a bit less heavy to me.
Im not sure about that. I think his rapping sounds a lot less corny. Maybe it's because I'm an east coast guy but the higher pitched rapping doesnt sit well with me.
Nobody even wants to talk about it? just instant downvoting?

For real. I can deal with a few months of constant product merchandising with the idea that new music will be out soon but it's been almost a year since the last music we've heard and everything he releases now is new apparel and random TTS shit. He uses his AVA social media as a product plug too which imo drives new fans away. He hasnt even talked about music at all in the past year minus the "announcement" of new music for his new movie. He also keeps hinting at announcements like the new "HUGE" project which he was supposed to announce by now. He's driving his reputation into the ground while making his old fans sick of the constant merchandise plug on all his social media while also turning new fans off to his music.

WRITING.TITLE: This is going to be a very unpopular opinion on this subreddit but I think the SA rapping is very cheesy and even ruins songs on the newer stuff.
WRITING.TEXT: That kind of rapping has a very 90's/early 2000's feel to it. I always was fine with it on the older stuff because it worked back then for the time period. Even one of my favorite songs is "Galaxy".I just cant get on board with the high pitched rapping on the new stuff like "Too late". It's one of my favorite songs ever made until the SA rapping part. Even my friends go "yikes" when it gets to that part. I know he's part of the band it he's not going away but I'm just curious to know if anybody else feels that way too.
